title: A good with zero cost is not scarce

content.question: In which of the following situations is a good NOT scarce?

choices.label: Consumer give up nothing to obtain more of the good.
ConsumerÂ can purchase as much of the good as they want at its current market price.
Large quantities of the good are available in the marketplace.
There is a surplus of the good at some positive price.
There is a shortage of the good at some positive price.

content.answer: Consumer give up nothing to obtain more of the good.
